summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, setting the trial start date for November 29, 2021, with jury selection the week of November 15, 2021. The order grants the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act and adjusts the pre-trial schedule, requiring the parties to confer on disclosure deadlines.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order sets the trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order regarding the trial schedule and pre-trial procedures in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Jury Selection Scheduled
events.description: The court orders that jury selection for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial occur during the week of November 15, 2021.

events.title: Trial Commencement Scheduled
events.description: The court sets November 29, 2021, as the date for opening statements to the jury in the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, pending approval from the Clerk's Office.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Letter on Pre-trial Schedule
events.description: The parties are ordered to meet, confer, and submit a joint letter by May 14, 2021, proposing adjustments to the pre-trial disclosure schedule.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Judge Alison J. Nathan set the trial start date for Ghislaine Maxwell as November 29, 2021, with jury selection the week of November 15, 2021.

The court granted the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act until November 29, 2021, citing the need for defense review of discovery, motion preparation, and trial preparation.
The order requires the parties to meet, confer, and submit a joint letter by May 14, 2021, to propose adjustments to the pre-trial disclosure schedule.
Motions in limine must be fully briefed no later than four weeks before the November 29 trial date to ensure no delay in commencement.
